    • Method Detail

      • getSiteDomain

        public java.lang.String getSiteDomain()
        Returnes prefixed domain instead of the one defined in the database. Prefixed domain calculated as: siteDomain = prefix + siteDbDomain;
        where "prefix" is defined in digi.xml's <server-type> tag.

        Prefixes help independant installations on different physical servers (different IPs) to use the same database hence the same domain records, for sites. By putting prefix in digi.xml the domain names that system uses runtime will change, so you can assign prefixed domain names to a different server (say, development or staging), but use the same database records.

      • toUrl

        public java.lang.String toUrl()

      • setSiteDomain

        public void setSiteDomain(java.lang.String siteDomain)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated (see comment for getSiteDomain). It should never be used, normally. setSiteDbDomain should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        siteDomain -

      • getSiteDbDomain

        public java.lang.String getSiteDbDomain()
        This is the hibernate-persisted domain value in the database. The value that Digi uses, in runtime is siteDomain and it is calculated as: siteDomain = prefix + siteDbDomain;
        where "prefix" is defined in digi.xml's <server-type> tag.

        Prefixes help independant installations on different physical servers (different IPs) to use the same database hence the same domain records, for sites. By putting prefix in digi.xml the domain names that system uses runtime will change, so you can assign prefixed domain names to a different server (say, development or staging), but use the same database records.

      • getEnableSecurity

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableSecurity()
        Returns "enableSecurity" flag for the site domain. If null, domain can be used both for secure and unsecure operations.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • setSiteDbDomain

        public void setSiteDbDomain(java.lang.String siteDbDomain)

      • setEnableSecurity

        public void setEnableSecurity(java.lang.Boolean enableSecurity)
        Sets "enableSecurity" flag for the site domain. If null, domain can be used both for secure and unsecure operations.
        Parameters:
        enableSecurity - Boolean

      • isSecure

        public boolean isSecure()
        If domain is secure or "enableSecurity" flag is not set at all, returns true. Otherwise returns false
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isUnsecure

        public boolean isUnsecure()
        If domain is unsecure or "enableSecurity" flag is not set at all, returns true. Otherwise returns false
        Returns:
        boolean
